workflow.name: Strip secrets from JSON file via AI Formatter + Merge node&send mail report
workflow.description:
## Description

This workflow sanitizes any uploaded n8n workflow JSON by removing credentials, webhook IDs, and sensitive metadata. Using AI and structured comparison, it generates a clean, secure workflow version, creates a downloadable sanitized file, and emails a detailed change-log report to the user.

## Key Features
‚Ä¢ AI-powered sanitization of workflow JSON
‚Ä¢ Automatic removal of secrets, credentials,  
  webhook IDs, and metadata
‚Ä¢ Node-level change detection and comparison
‚Ä¢ Generates sanitized workflow file (JSON)
‚Ä¢ Sends formatted HTML email report with 
  attachment
‚Ä¢ Supports customization for additional 
  filtering rules

## How It Works

The user uploads a workflow JSON file, which is extracted and formatted. AI then sanitizes the workflow and returns a secure version. Both original and sanitized workflows are merged for analysis, and a structured change-log is generated. A sanitized JSON file is created and emailed to the user with the report.

## How to Use

Upload your workflow JSON via the form. The workflow processes it automatically, generates a sanitized version, creates a change-log, and emails both the report and sanitized JSON file to you.

## Requirements
‚Ä¢ OpenAI credentials
‚Ä¢ Gmail or SMTP credentials 
‚Ä¢ n8n workflow JSON exported from the editor

## Customising This Workflow

Modify sanitization rules, formatting logic, or email templates inside the JS and AI nodes to suit organizational security policies or custom metadata filtering.

## Support: 

Join n8n Discord https://discord.com/invite/n8n
or
Community Forum https://community.n8n.io/

README file available at https://bit.ly/GeneratesanitizedJSONfile

workflow.name: Sanitize JSON and Send Email Report_Final

parameters.formTitle: Upload Json file to convert to Sanitized JSON version
parameters.formDescription: Upload Json file to convert to Sanitized JSON version

values.content:
=You are n8n Workflow Secret Sanitizer.

Your only job is to receive one n8n workflow JSON and return a fully sanitized version that is safe to share and fully importable back into n8n.

Follow these rules strictly:

1. RETURN ONLY THE SANITIZED JSON OBJECT.
   - No explanations, no markdown, no code fences, no text outside the JSON.
   - Output must be valid JSON.

2. REMOVE the following everywhere in the workflow:
   - Any key named "credentials"
   - Any key named "webhookId"
   - Root-level: "meta", "versionId", "id"

3. STICKY NOTES (type: "n8n-nodes-base.stickyNote"):
   - Do not modify them in any way.
   - Do NOT sanitize emails, URLs, or text inside sticky notes.
   - Preserve their content, color, size, position, and metadata.

4. DO NOT MODIFY:
   - Node id, name, type, typeVersion
   - Node positions
   - Connections
   - Any n8n expression syntax (for example, expressions that begin with "=" and use n8n-style placeholders).

5. REPLACE secret-like values with placeholders:
   - clientId ‚Üí "YOUR_CLIENT_ID_HERE"
   - clientSecret ‚Üí "YOUR_CLIENT_SECRET_HERE"
   - API keys / tokens ‚Üí "YOUR_API_KEY_HERE", "YOUR_BEARER_TOKEN", or "REDACTED_TOKEN"
   - Email addresses ‚Üí "YOUR_EMAIL@EXAMPLE.COM"
   - Public document URLs ‚Üí "REPLACE_WITH_YOUR_URL"

6. SPECIAL RULES:
   - Google Translate (service account): remove credentials; keep authentication field; no other changes.
   - ConvertAPI URLs: replace Secret=... with Secret=YOUR_CONVERTAPI_SECRET or append if missing.
   - Gmail OAuth2 nodes: remove Gmail credentials object.
   - JavaScript nodes: only replace literal strings containing secrets; do not change code structure.

7. The final output must be:
   - A single valid JSON object
   - Sanitized according to all rules
   - Directly importable into n8n.

If the workflow is very large, you may truncate fields like systemMessage or long descriptions only if needed to stay within the model‚Äôs context limit, but keep structure and logic intact.

=Compare the following two n8n workflow JSONs and produce a structured change log.

ORIGINAL WORKFLOW:
{{ JSON.stringify($json.originalWorkflowJson) }}

SANITIZED WORKFLOW:
{{ JSON.stringify($json.sanitizedWorkflowJson) }}

Return:

1. Node-by-node list of changes
2. Placeholders inserted
3. Summary of removed secrets

=Output format rules (very important): Return the change log as HTML, not Markdown. Do not wrap the result in or tags ‚Äì just the inner HTML. Use this style for the main section headings (‚Äú1. Node-by-node‚Ä¶‚Äù, ‚Äú2. Placeholders‚Ä¶‚Äù, ‚Äú3. Summary‚Ä¶‚Äù):

1. Node-by-node list of changes

(18px ‚âà about 3pt bigger than normal body text.) For node names inside section 1, use:

Node: When chat message received

Use
  • ...
for bullet lists. Keep the same wording you used before; just change the formatting. At the end, include the overall summary in a

with bold text:

Overall, the sanitized workflow preserves all functional logic but removes any secret credentials, webhook IDs, and user-specific metadata, replacing them with placeholders for user customization and security.

Do not escape the HTML (no < / >); it must be real HTML tags.

parameters.subject: ={{ 'Sanitized n8n workflow JSON: ' + $node["Upload Workflow Json"].binary["Upload_JSON_file"].fileName }}

parameters.content:
## Input Collection

Form node collects MailId and uploaded JSON.

## Extract + Prepare Original Workflow

Extracts uploaded file into structured JSON.
Wraps parsed JSON into originalWorkflowJson.
Stringifies and prepares payload for sanitization.

## AI Sanitization Engine






















Removes secrets & metadata while preserving structure. Outputs valid JSON.
Parses sanitized JSON into sanitizedWorkflowJson

## Comparison Engine (Original vs Sanitized)

Merge node pairs both versions for comparison.
Produces Markdown/HTML-ready diff report.

## Create Sanitized JSON File

Converts sanitized JSON string into 
sanitized_workflow.json.

## Assemble Email & Send

Merges report and file.
Gmail node sends HTML email and attachment.
##  Generate Sanitized workflow JSON  file using AI Formatter + Merge nodes and email report

# Try Out

## Overview

This workflow sanitizes any uploaded n8n workflow JSON by removing credentials, webhook IDs, tokens, and sensitive metadata. It generates a clean, secure version, produces a detailed change-log, and emails both the sanitized file and report to the user.

## How it Works

‚Ä¢	User uploads a workflow JSON + email.
‚Ä¢	JSON is parsed, normalized, and pre-processed.
‚Ä¢	AI removes secrets, credentials, webhook IDs, and sensitive metadata.
‚Ä¢	Original vs sanitized versions are compared to create a structured change-log.
‚Ä¢	Sanitized JSON file is generated.
‚Ä¢	Email with formatted report + attachment is sent to the user.


## Use Cases

‚Ä¢	Sharing workflows without exposing secrets
‚Ä¢	Publishing workflows to the community securely
‚Ä¢	Auditing workflow configurations
‚Ä¢	Internal compliance and security checks


## Setup Requirements

‚Ä¢	OpenAI API credentials
‚Ä¢	Email credentials (Gmail or SMTP)
‚Ä¢	JSON file exported from n8n


## Need Help?

Join n8n Discord https://discord.com/invite/n8n
 or Community Forum https://community.n8n.io/
README file available at https://bit.ly/GeneratesanitizedJSONfile
